description.plain:
Ermias Joseph Asghedom (August 15, 1985 – March 31, 2019), better known as Nipsey Hussle, was a Grammy-award winning hip-hop artist and mogul from the Crenshaw district of South Central Los Angeles, California.

With a name inspired by actor Nipsey Russell, Nipsey Hussle released his first project, Slauson Boy Volume 1, in 2005, and he was featured in XXL’s 2010 Freshman Class alongside J. Cole, Big Sean, Freddie Gibbs, Wiz Khalifa, and Jay Rock among others. Nipsey gained national headlines in 2013 as he sold copies of his Crenshaw mixtape for $100 each. One customer was JAY-Z, who purchased 100 copies in support of Nipsey’s hustle. He then charged $1,000 per copy of his Mailbox Money mixtape in 2014 to continue his #Proud2Pay campaign.

After a decade of releasing several mixtapes and singles, Nipsey released his long-awaited debut album Victory Lap in 2018. The album was nominated in the Best Rap Album category at the 2019 Grammy Awards.

On top of being a rapper, Nipsey was also a community activist and entrepreneur in his Crenshaw neighborhood. He helped establish Destination Crenshaw, a 1.3-mile open-air museum highlighting local art, as well as the Vector 90 STEM workspace and his store The Marathon Clothing.

On March 31, 2019, Nipsey was the victim of a shooting outside of his store on the corner of Crenshaw & Slauson in L.A. He passed away at the age of 33.

On April 11, 2019, thousands of mourners attended a nationally televised celebration of life ceremony held for Nipsey at Staples Center in L.A. The following day, the Los Angeles City Council voted unanimously to rename the intersection of Crenshaw & Slauson as “Nipsey Hussle Square” in his honor. In 2020, Nipsey posthumously won Grammy Awards in the Best Rap Performance category for “Racks in the Middle” with Roddy Ricch and Hit-Boy, and in the Best Rap/Sung Performance category for his collaboration with DJ Khaled and John Legend on “Higher.” On what would have been his 37th birthday, Nipsey Hussle was honored with a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame on August 15, 2022.

body.plain:
Ermias Joseph Asghedom (August 15, 1985 – March 31, 2019), better known as Nipsey Hussle, was a Grammy-award winning hip-hop artist and mogul from the Crenshaw district of South Central Los Angeles, California.

With a name inspired by actor Nipsey Russell, Nipsey Hussle released his first project, Slauson Boy Volume 1, in 2005, and he was featured in XXL’s 2010 Freshman Class alongside J. Cole, Big Sean, Freddie Gibbs, Wiz Khalifa, and Jay Rock among others. Nipsey gained national headlines in 2013 as he sold copies of his Crenshaw mixtape for $100 each. One customer was JAY-Z, who purchased 100 copies in support of Nipsey’s hustle. He then charged $1,000 per copy of his Mailbox Money mixtape in 2014 to continue his #Proud2Pay campaign.

After a decade of releasing several mixtapes and singles, Nipsey released his long-awaited debut album Victory Lap in 2018. The album was nominated in the Best Rap Album category at the 2019 Grammy Awards.

On top of being a rapper, Nipsey was also a community activist and entrepreneur in his Crenshaw neighborhood. He helped establish Destination Crenshaw, a 1.3-mile open-air museum highlighting local art, as well as the Vector 90 STEM workspace and his store The Marathon Clothing.

On March 31, 2019, Nipsey was the victim of a shooting outside of his store on the corner of Crenshaw & Slauson in L.A. He passed away at the age of 33.

On April 11, 2019, thousands of mourners attended a nationally televised celebration of life ceremony held for Nipsey at Staples Center in L.A. The following day, the Los Angeles City Council voted unanimously to rename the intersection of Crenshaw & Slauson as “Nipsey Hussle Square” in his honor. In 2020, Nipsey posthumously won Grammy Awards in the Best Rap Performance category for “Racks in the Middle” with Roddy Ricch and Hit-Boy, and in the Best Rap/Sung Performance category for his collaboration with DJ Khaled and John Legend on “Higher.” On what would have been his 37th birthday, Nipsey Hussle was honored with a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame on August 15, 2022.

songs.full_title: Victory Lap by Nipsey Hussle (Ft. Stacy Barthe)
songs.title: Victory Lap

description.plain:
“Victory Lap” serves as both the titular track and intro song on Nipsey Hussle’s debut album, Victory Lap. On the track, Hussle boasts about his abilities; from rapping to firing weapons, while also reflecting on his journey to fame.

The Stacy Barthe sung chorus interpolates the Arctic Monkeys' 2013 song “Knee Socks” and references the movie Mean Streets.

They don't make 'em bar none, they don't make 'em real
They don't make it where I'm from, they don't take it here
They ain't see in due time, I be makin' mils
Bossed up in this game, I been makin' deals
Get your lawyer on the phone, we can make it real
I got checks and balance, I flex dramatic
Other fifty on my neck, just my reckless habit
Ain't no pussy on my rep, disrespect the savage
I make one phone call and the rest get handled
It's just another front step with candles
Lil' message from the set, "We accept your challenge"

songs.full_title: Double Up by Nipsey Hussle (Ft. Belly & DOM KENNEDY)
songs.title: Double Up

description.plain: “Double Up” is a bonus track from Nipsey Hussle’s highly anticipated debut album, Victory Lap. The track features Canadian rapper Belly and L.A.’s Dom Kennedy, who last collaborated with Nipsey on “Real Nigga Moves” from Nipsey’s 2014 mixtape Mailbox Money.

songs.full_title: Racks in the Middle by Nipsey Hussle (Ft. Hit-Boy & Roddy Ricch)
songs.title: Racks in the Middle
songs.title_with_featured: Racks in the Middle (Ft. Hit-Boy & Roddy Ricch)

description.plain:
Nipsey Hussle’s final record before his untimely murder, “Racks In The Middle” is a collaboration with producer Hit-Boy and L.A. rapper Roddy Ricch.

In this song, Nipsey discusses the fruits of his labor, how he enjoys being at the peak of his career and having the best year of his life. He also reflects on how good it felt to see his grandma on a Jet and how he cannot bring his homie Fatts back to life even with all of the success he’s been tasting.

Nipsey dropped his long-awaited, critically acclaimed debut album Victory Lap on February 16th, 2018. The record debuted in the top 5 of the Billboard 200 and netted him his first Grammy nomination for Best Rap Album in 2019.

This is the last single to be released during Nipsey Hussle’s lifetime before his tragic death on March 31st, 2019.

He also reflects on how good it felt to see his grandma on a Jet and how he cannot bring his homie Fatts back to life even with all of the success he’s been tasting.

Nipsey dropped his long-awaited, critically acclaimed debut album Victory Lap on February 16th, 2018. The record debuted in the top 5 of the Billboard 200 and netted him his first Grammy nomination for Best Rap Album in 2019.

This is the last single to be released during Nipsey Hussle’s lifetime before his tragic death on March 31st, 2019.
